intro: Tetrapterys cuneifolia var. eglandulosa, commonly known as the glandular-leaf tetrapterys, is a shrub native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered with small glands, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by small, round fruits. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and ecological niche, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
